cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles southwest of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the southeastern and central Gulf of Mexico, aiming for the northern Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana–coastal Mississippi corridor)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana near the Mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely; hurricane-force gusts possible if the core tracks just west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge 4–7 ft along the Mississippi coast, including Pascagoula Harbor and adjacent bays.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches of rain possible Sunday into Monday with embedded higher totals, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; possible riverine flooding inland after landfall.
